title: Somethimes Thunderbird downloads messages but does not show them
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for about 10 years and I'm very happy with the program. Recently a disturning issue came up though: incoming emails sometimes seem to disappear from my inbox.

What happens is that when checking my email the Thunderbirds status bar says "downloading message n of m" and "received n of n messages", however no new messages are shown in my Inbox. And indeed: some messages - that I know have been sent to me - simpy have not arrived, which is worrying.

The email is downloaded via the POP protocol, and I have now changed the settings to keep the mail on the server for two days. Then I can use webmail, and indeed there the missing messages are present.

I already used the Repair option in the Properties of the Inbox. Not sure if that helped, as the problem is present only now and then. Also: the missing emails did not seem malformed (and downloading emails is not totally blocked, what could be caused by a mailformed email).

Does anyone have a suggestion about what may case this problem ?

Lex.
creator: lennings

title: version 115 and "Archives"
content:
Hi, I've upgraded to 115 a few days ago, and: - the Archives, stored in "Archives" folder are disappeared - the Sent mail, whose folder now is another respect to the past, doesn't show ALL the sent mail of years ago, but only a selected - how ? - set of these messages

Of course, I've saved all the files of profiles, but i don't know how recuperate my old archives only ...

Thanks in advance for help Andrea

title: Lost subdirectiories in Thunderbird. (se è più facile o utile posso ripetere la domanda in italiano)
content: I was trying to make order in my Thunderbird archives by creating some "mega-directories" in order to store there several old directories. I was able to transfer a lot of existing directories, but I failed with two of them, very big and full of sub-directiories. During the operations I lost almost all the subdirectories. How can I use a backup to recover the lost subdirectories?
creator: l.piccioni

title: Inaccessibilità cartella Archivi
content:
Dopo l'aggiornamento alla 115, sono successe due cose:

- Sono sparite le cartelle sotto "Archivi", dove erano catalogate diverse annate di mail ... - Anche buona parte della posta Inviata è sparita ...

Per il primo problema, andando sotto la directory del profilo, vedo che, sotto la <profilo>.default\Mail ho sia sotto "Local Folders" che sotto la "firenze.dedalus.eu", due cartelle "Archives.sbd" con dentro, evidentemente, tutto ... ma non so come renderle visibili in Thunderbird !

Per l'inviata, dato che la posta aziendale (IMAP) è via office, ho viso che sotto "ImapMail", adesso ci sono TRE cartelle - outlook.office365.com, outlook.office365-1.com, outlook.office365-2.com - con dentro file dallo stesso nome - INBOX.msf e Sent.msf - ma di dimensioni molto diverse... probabilmente andrebbero fuse: ma come ?

Anche perché non funzionano più i tool precedenti....

Qualcuno ha soluzioni ?

Andrea

title: Deleted emails in Thunderbird reappear almost instantly
content:
I have tried to fix this several times, and today followed instructions for going into the settings folder and deleting the trash and trash msf files - nothing fixes it.

I am trying to clear out my inbox, so I am choosing a large number of emails at a time and deleting them. I can do this successfully once, but after that, the supposedly deleted emails pop back up in my inbox. I switched from Microsoft two years ago and am fully on Linux Cinnamon. I tried Thunderbird right off, ran into this problem, ditched it, then went back since I prefer an email client to webmail. I have donated to support both Linux and Thunderbird, since I greatly appreciate these open-source products. But if I can't keep my inbox under control, I'll have to go back to webmail.

My email (protonmail) is IMAP. Thunderbird version is 102.11.0.

I'm running updates today, but since this has happened over several versions, I doubt that will fix it.

Can anyone help?
creator: knh11

title: Thunderbird 52 not working on Mac Monterey
content:
I’ve still been using 52.9.1 for various reasons for years without problem. I use it for POP mail only, with several accounts in a global inbox. Having just upgraded to Monterey on Mac, I now can’t access most of it. Eg: - Folder pane is completely blank. - Trying to click on various (most?) buttons or menu items or trying to restart with with add-ons disabled, results in a blurred overlay and TB hanging, so I have to force quit TB.

On opening Thunderbird, the toolbars and Quick Folders (add-on) tabs are visible and the list of emails from Inbox is visible. The only thing I seem to be able to open successfully is the Troubleshooting Information. I can’t access my account settings or various other parts, and I daren’t try clicking anywhere else as I suspect it’ll just hang again or even make things worse.

I don’t know if it would help, but I have a backup copy of my profile folder from just before the upgrade to Monterey, which I’ve always stored separately in my “Home” folder. Would replacing the contents of the current profile folder with those from my backup be of any use?

Thanks for any help!

title: Editing Thunderbird Contacts
content:
I am using Thunderbird 102.13.0.

When viewing a contact in Thunderbird Address Book, it opens as a narrow window at the bottom of the screen, as in the attached picture (I have blanked out personal data in this).

You can only see a couple of lines at a time. To see more of the contact it is necesssary to scroll up and down. This is particularly inconvenient when trying to edit a contact or cut-paste details.

You can get a bit more by cutting down the depth of the contacts list above, but this is also not always convenient.

Is there any way of opening the contact record in a separate window, as you can an email or a calendar entry?

Thanks in advance,

Roger

title: Message list on v.115 does not update when an email is deleted.
content: I'm a *long-time* TB user and have recently upgraded to 115.0 (BuildID: 20230711125218) on Linux (Kubuntu 22.04.2 LTS). I have multiple accounts configured to use the unified folders inbox. When in that unified inbox, if I delete an email, it stays in the message list instead of disappearing, although the focus changes (the message entry line was highlighted in blue background with white text, and is now in black text on a gray background). The message pane shows the next message as it should. If i click on the message list entry line for the deleted email, nothing happens in the message pane (it still shows the next email), although the focus does come back to the message list entry line. This does not appear to happen when I am in the inboxes of my individual email accounts, but only happens in the unified folder. When I return to the unified folder inbox from the individual account inbox, the deleted message is gone. Thanks for any help.

title: exceeded number of maximum connections, tried suggestions, no joy
content:
Short note: 3 email accounts (all IMAP) in my Thunderbird account on my laptop (PC running Win10). One of these accounts stopped downloading mail on Friday 14 July (no changes made by me personally). Error msg: .... "may have exceeded the number of maximum connections." (NOTES: 1) the university made changes on Friday that may or may not be related to dropping Skype and now we must all use TEAMS. 2) In checking my settings, I did note a need to change the IMAP server port -- and I did so).

What I tried: 1. turned off my iphone (which is downloading email for all of these 3 accounts perfectly) 2. checking all my Thunderbird settings (incoming / outgoing settings), all good. 2. reduced the number connections from 5 to 3 (for all 3 accounts), and then again from 3 to 1 (for all 3 accounts). no joy. 3. increased time between checking email.

Still no joy. What else can I try? What else do you need to know to help me? Thanks lots!

title: Why do two message windows open to reply to one email? and more problems
content:
Hello,

I have used Thunderbird for a long time, and I'm now experiencing multiple problems, I'm told it could be a conflict with AVG, however, I've used AVG for a long time as well, so I'm skeptical compatibility is an issue.

1. To respond to an email TB opens two messages to send, only one is necessary but I can't find a setting to change this option.

2. The arrow on a thread flickers up and down whilst clicking, it may take between 5-10 clicks to open, then it opens every message in the thread in new windows.

3. NVIDIA was installed after the update, does anyone know what that is, please?

Thank you for your efforts in providing a quality email service, I'm looking forward to a response.
creator: Trassa

title: New Thunderbird installation doesn't ask for password
content:
New computer. Windows 10. Fresh install of Thunderbird (v. 115.0 (64-bit). Got my profile migrated over. I've triple-checked the server settings (name, port, security settings, etc. are identical to on my old computer). But when I click "Get Messages," nothing happens. Doesn't prompt for password, doesn't attempt to connect to the server.

I never had any saved passwords in Tbird, so it's not that.

Doesn't appear to be the firewall (Norton 360). I was all over in those settings and even turned it completely off briefly, same result.

I'll keep Googling, but so far, these two issues seem to be the problem, but as far as I can tell, it's not either one. Thoughts?

Thanks much, AJS
creator: ajschn67

title: Not getting all my emails from my ISP
content: I exchanged one email address with another on my service provider Spectrum. Now I'm not getting some of my service providers emails coming into thunderbird. So I go to Spectrum and I find them there. I read them there and the bold comes off on Thunderbird. But the emails don't come through so I can only read them from the Spectrum website. Does this have something to do with 'migration'?
creator: RobinClaire

title: Show app badge icon still not working in non-admin accounts a year and a half later after bug report
content:
The show app badge icon option for new or unread emails is still not working in non-admin accounts in Thunderbird 115. I am very disappointed it has not been fixed in the latest release as I filed a bug report on Bugzilla over a year and a half ago and it appears it has not been followed up on. I used to use the badge extension that did the same thing, but since the developer noted that since Thunderbird added the feature, he is no longer developing or supporting this add-on. This is unfortunate, because IT DOESN"T WORK unless you use an admin account. I have verified this using my admin boot and my laptop which only has an admin account, but my bug report still says after a year and a half this is "unverified". Apparently I will die from something before this gets fixed. Until then, with my poor eyes unable to see the tiny red dot in the system tray when I have new mail, I will have to open Thunderbird each time to see of any of my family has sent an email.

BTW, I have tried checking the box to get system notifications in Windows 10, but this has proven to be unreliable with Microsoft seemingly breaking something with every monthly security update I get.

Is it too much to ask to get a working new email badge in non-admin accounts?
creator: lmw2020

title: The add-on "Full address column"
content:
The add-on "full address column" stopped working with the upgrade to thunderbird version 115. I removed and reinstalled the add-on but it did not work. On the older versions, an incoming email would show who it was from and their email address. By knowing the email address of the sender, you could determine if it was a scam or not.

Is there a way to make this add-on work with the new upgraded 115 version?

PLEASE BRING BACK THE WAY IT WAS!!!
